intro: Saxifraga aizoon subsp. euaizoon, commonly known as the desert saxifrage, is a perennial flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its low, mat-forming growth habit and produces small, white or pink flowers during the spring and early summer. The plant has succulent leaves that help it store water, adapting to its harsh, dry environment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Saxifraga aizoon subsp. euaizoon is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing soil in arid landscapes.
